name: Titanium.UI.iOS.PushBehavior
summary: Continuous or instantaneous force to apply to an item.

parameters.name: item
parameters.summary: View object to add to the behavior.

methods.name: removeItem
methods.summary: Removes the specified item from this behavior.

properties.name: active
properties.description: Set to true to activate the force or false to deactivate it. Use this property rather than removing and re-adding the behavior to the animator.

properties.name: angle
properties.summary: Specifies the angle of the force vector in radians.
properties.description: To configure the force vector, you need to also specify the magnitude property.

properties.name: magnitude
properties.summary: Specifies the magnitude of the force vector.
properties.description:
A value of 1.0 represents an acceleration of 100 points per second squared if the item is 100 x 100 points with a density of 1.0.

To configure the push vector, you need to also specify the angle property.

properties.name: pushDirection
properties.summary: Specifies the direction of the force vector as an x, y pair.
properties.description:
For example, specifiying {x: 0.0, y: 1.0} indicates a positive upward force of 100 points per second squared if the item is 100 x 100 points with a density of 1.0.

Specifiying a negative value reverses the direction of the force.
